 * @file    PWRCU/DeepSleepMode1/readme.txt
 * @version V1.00
 * @date    2014-06-30
 * @brief   Description of PWRCU Deep Sleep Mode 1 example.
Example Description:

This example shows how to drive the system into Deep Sleep Mode 1 and be waken up by EXTI Channel wakeup event and RTC compare match wakeup.

The KEY1 Button EXTI Channel is configured to generate wakeup event on low level. The RTC is configured to generate Compare Match Wakeup event and the RTC time base is set to 1 second by the external low speed oscillator(LSE).

The system clock is set to 48/40 MHz by the external high speed oscillator(HSE).

Press KEY1 to enter the infinite loop:

  • Short delay 0.5 second
  • Configure RTC to generate a compare match in 3 seconds
  • Configure EXTI channel to wake up the system on low level
  • Turn off LED1
  • Enter Deep Sleep Mode 1
  • Turn on LED1

Three leds LED1, LED2 and LED3 are used to monitor the system state as following:

  • LED1 on: system in RUN mode
  • LED1 off: system in Deep Sleep Mode 1
  • LED2 is toggled if KEY1 EXTI Channel is used to exit from Deep Sleep Mode 1
  • LED3 is toggled if RTC Compare Match is used to exit from Deep Sleep Mode 1
Directory Contents:
  • PWRCU/DeepSleepMode1/main.c Main program
  • PWRCU/DeepSleepMode1/ht32fxxxx_it.c Interrupt handlers
Hardware and Software Environment:
  • This example can be run on HT32 Series development board.
Note:
For power consumption measurement in Deep Sleep Mode 1:
  • Modify the example code to configure all unused GPIO pins as input floating. The "DISABLE_DEBUG_PIN" setting in the example code could configure SWDIO, SWCLK, SWO as input floating.
  • Replace MVDD jumper with an ampere meter.
Re-download the code after this example running:
  • The debug adapter such as e-Link32 can not communicate with the chip when it enters into Deep Sleep Mode 1. Please press the Reset button on the board and then click the download icon before it enters into Deep Sleep Mode 1.
  • If SWD debug pins are configured as input floating, please follow the steps: 1. Power off, set booting jumpers as boot from SRAM. 2. Power on, download the code. 3. Power off, set booting jumpers as boot from Main Flash. 4. Power on.
